messages: 641369bf774de5d788df45f6e6e8bc4a (02:06): is everyday one word or two
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:09): depends
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:09): Everyday is an adjective; it only precedes nouns. Every day is an adverbial phrase which means "daily."
21748e60169b8177e9d974625c7daf70 (02:10): http://dictionary.cambridge.org/define.asp?key=26638&dict=CALD
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:10): As I said; it depends on the context in which he is trying to use it.
21748e60169b8177e9d974625c7daf70 (02:11): ok ok *backs off*, just giving some links on a definition =S
b744afb5f6e82c16467c6acc18a053cf (02:12): im a tard, whats the correct way to get two divs in the same row with float:left and float:right?
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (02:13): set the widths to a total of less than 100%
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (02:13): and float them both left, or both right
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (02:13): both left is probably best

bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:13): Not trashing your help LEMONed but that is like trying to answer a question such as "What is the best way to get to Dallas?" without knowing the point of origin.
b744afb5f6e82c16467c6acc18a053cf (02:13): but i need one lef tand one right
b744afb5f6e82c16467c6acc18a053cf (02:13): woops, one left and one right
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:13): MACscr: me thinks you do not understand floats that well
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (02:13): floating them both left will put one left, and the other to the right of it
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:14): give what JDigital says a try and see for yourself
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (02:14): they will still be on the same row

557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:05): hey guys, I have a weeeeird box model issue with firefox...
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:05): http://www.mentallyretired.com/testcase.html http://www.mentallyretired.com/testcase2.html <-- What in the world?
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:06): it's applying padding to the width of the box, IE style
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:06): ]xENo[, applying padding to width, meaning
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:06): the width of the box
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:06): width becomes padding+width, or it's inside the width
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:06): not in firefox though
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:06): no I mean
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:06): which of both
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:06): thats the reason that IEs box model is broken
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:07): width ebcomes padding + width
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:07): ]xENo[, ok that's the correct model right
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:07): so if Firefox is wrong it should be doing the opposite
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:07): slow down man, you're getting all philosophical on me
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:07): in FF and w3c compliant browsers
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:08): padding does not effect the width of the element
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:08): ]xENo[, you need to be phylosophical if you're gonna work with CSS. Either this, or you end up crazy.. Yea.
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:08): it simply applies the padding on the inside of the box
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:08): Vietnam, remember CSS in Vietnam.
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:08): it applies the padding to the width
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:08): which is incorrect
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:08): well, that test case, in firefox, is rendering identical to IE
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:08): which is incorrect
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:09): ]xENo[, yea, I'm confirming you got it the wrong way.
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:09): safari renders it the correct way, the way I *thought* firefox was rendering it
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:09): k, so I'm not crazy
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:09): What you think is wrong is the right model and vice versa
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:09): padding is supposed to be applied to the width?
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:09): and in fact adding padding to the width is the correct behaviour, and to confirm this, think: which would be better
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:09): padding to be added
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:09): or inside
557c746bbb65dd7d29a644db088b815c (03:09): padding inside
abea47ee107e111b99f7d8468c1d5940 (03:09): it'll be better to be on the inside right
